author: jochembrouwer
content: Is this still the right reference implementation? https://github.com/vulcanize/go-ethereum-EIP1559

author: timbeiko
content:
No, <@!508125616940515329>. I'm not sure the latest Geth one is public. <@!543900561460822016> was working on it, but he's been very busy with other stuff lately üòÖ 

Besu has an up to date implementation, I believe, and maybe Nethermind too

author: jochembrouwer
content: Thanks, I will use Besu as reference implementation. But it would be extremely helpful if we can get 1559 tests in ethereum/tests soon, because I am only confident that our implementation is correct if they pass the "official" tests

author: timbeiko
content: Yep, I think <@!574864862338088960> is still ironing out a few bugs in Besu, but we can start working on tests after that is done üëç

author: lightclient
content: <@!508125616940515329> you can track our implementation here: https://github.com/quilt/go-ethereum/pull/37

author: jochembrouwer
content: Is the gas pricing scheme for the access lists the same as EIP 2930?

author: jochembrouwer
content: This is not clear from the EIP, it does not state any gas charges for the access lists or if it should follow EIP2930

author: lightclient
content: hmm, that's a good point it should be clearly specified in the EIP

author: lightclient
content: i haven't implemented any deviation in gas costs for 1559 access lists

author: jochembrouwer
content: So you charge 0 gas for access lists or use the EIP2930 costs?

author: lightclient
content: sorry, to be clear i use the same schedule as eip2930
